page.title: 07The Wildlife of Knockholt
page.content: The many woods and copses encourage a wide variety of wildlife; foxes,roe and fallow deer, badgers, mink,hares, grey squirrels, stoats, weasels, bats and small mammals of all sorts are found here, also rabbits in a variety of colours. The lake near Combe Wood has a heronery and other water birds. Watercress grows where springs come from the chalk. Barn and tawny owls can be heard if not seen. All the common hedgerow and garden birds abound as there are many wooded and uncultivated corners. Pheasants, reared for shooting, are a common sight also lapwings, curlews, yellow hammers, nuthatches, tree-creepers, Canada geese and kestrels. Butterflies and moths seen include blue butterflies on the chalk slopes, dragonflies, tortoise-shells, peacocks and red admirals.
